intro: Cleistanthus blancoi, commonly known as the white-flowered cleistanthus, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy texture. The flowers are small and yellowish-green, often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts.
